result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Scott R. Tucker
parties.address: 214 S 3rd Street Unit 1, Black River Falls, WI 54615

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.  Defendant shall comply with mental health treatments, medications  and release all records to the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is not to possess or take any medications unless prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.    The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

timeConds.notes: Defendant was granted 47 days credit from time served.  Huber granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was granted 235 days credit for time served.
Consecutive to: Jail sentences in cases 16CM121,15CM183, 15CM221 and 15CM191 are all consecutive to each other

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
All costs and fees reduced to a civil judgment
